definition: Haydn (name)/Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809), Austrian classical composer
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: Franz Joseph Haydn is one of the Vienna classical famous composers.
sentences.chinese: 海頓是“維也納古典樂派三傑”之一。

sentences.english: Cabell, of course, was quick to see Haydon's hand at work.
sentences.chinese: 當然，卡貝爾一眼便看出了這都是海頓之手在起作用。

sentences.english: So, does all this imply Mozart was in some way a better composer than Haydn?
sentences.chinese: 這是否說明莫扎特是比海頓更優秀的作曲家？
海頓的實驗涉及兩項工作。

sentences.english: Haydn, the son of poor parents, had been a choir boy in VIENNA Cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 海頓出身貧寒，曾當過維也納大教堂唱詩班的歌童。

definition: Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
double reed wind instrument (such as oboe or bassoon)
Lai Shengchuan (1954-), US-Taiwanese dramatist and director
